Descriptions: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to reach logical conclusions.
The ability to generate a large number of ideas on a particular topic.
The ability to identify patterns and relationships to make generalizations or predictions.
The ability to come up with unique and innovative ideas or solutions.
The ability to recognize when something is likely to go wrong and anticipate potential issues.
The ability to use mathematical methods to solve problems.
The ability to quickly and accurately work with numbers.
The ability to understand written information and extract relevant meaning.
The ability to communicate ideas effectively in written form.
